intro: Impatiens sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically display shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
